skill.name: project-scaffolding
skill.description: IDE-grade project scaffolding wizard for creating new projects with comprehensive configuration. Supports 70+ project types: HTML/CSS websites, React, Next.js, Vue, Astro, Remix, React Native, Flutter, Expo, FastAPI, Django, Express, NestJS, Go/Gin, Rust/Axum, Spring Boot, Hono, Elysia, Chrome Extensions, VS Code Extensions, Tauri desktop apps, serverless functions, and more. Provides WebStorm/PyCharm-level project creation with interactive SDK selection, framework configuration, database setup, and DevOps tooling. Use when: creating a new project, setting up a framework application, initializing a codebase, scaffolding boilerplate, building extensions, creating mobile/desktop/web apps, setting up monorepos, or making static websites/landing pages.

security_audit.summary: All 446 static findings are FALSE POSITIVES. The skill is a passive project generator that creates file structures from templates without executing external commands, reading user credentials, or making network requests. The static analyzer misidentified markdown documentation examples and template strings as security issues.

content.value_statement: Creating new projects requires repetitive setup work across frameworks, languages, and tooling. This skill generates production-ready project structures with SDK selection, database configuration, linting, and CI/CD in a single command.
actual_capabilities: Creates 70+ project types including React, Next.js, FastAPI, Django, Go, Rust, and more
Generates complete project structure with framework configuration and dependencies
Sets up TypeScript, linting, formatting, testing, Docker, and GitHub Actions
Supports interactive SDK version selection for Node.js, Python, Go, Rust, and Java
Configures database connections and ORM for PostgreSQL, SQLite, MongoDB, and others
Creates VS Code settings, .gitignore, and environment templates
limitations: Does not run npm install or install dependencies - users must execute package manager commands
Cannot modify existing projects - only creates new project structures
Does not generate application business logic or database schemas

best_practices: Run npm install or pip install after scaffolding to fetch dependencies
Review and customize the generated .env.example file for your environment
Update package.json scripts to match your development workflow
anti_patterns: Do not commit .env files with actual secrets - use .env.example as template
Do not modify the scaffold.py directly - fork the project for custom needs
Do not expect database migrations - the skill creates schemas, not migration scripts

faq.question: What frameworks are supported?
faq.answer: 70+ frameworks including React, Next.js, Vue, Nuxt, Astro, Svelte, Angular, React Native, Flutter, Expo, FastAPI, Django, Flask, Express, NestJS, Fastify, Gin, Fiber, Axum, Spring Boot, and more.

faq.question: Does it install dependencies?
faq.answer: No. The skill generates project files with dependency lists. Users run npm install or pip install to install packages after scaffolding.

faq.question: Can it modify existing projects?
faq.answer: No. The skill creates new projects from templates. Existing projects must be modified manually or with separate tools.

faq.question: What languages are supported?
faq.answer: TypeScript, JavaScript, Python, Go, Rust, and Java. Language selection is part of the interactive wizard.

faq.question: Does it support monorepos?
faq.answer: Yes. Turborepo, Nx Workspace, and pnpm Workspace are supported project types.

faq.question: What databases can be configured?
faq.answer: PostgreSQL, MySQL, MongoDB, and SQLite with options for Prisma, SQLAlchemy, Drizzle, TypeORM, Mongoose, and other ORMs.
